page.title: 01GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: The area is wholly agricultural in the north, with mainly arable and dairy farming. Near Morden Heath in the south, most of the land is wooded. The land is generally undulating, with the highest area in the middle section. The main{A31}trunk road between Poole and Dorchester passes on an E-W line through the bottom half of the area, and although further south is popular with tourists, this part is rarely visited and has therefore remained therefore largely unspoilt. There are four settlements; Morden and Bloxworth (which together count for 75% of the total population of about 570), and East and West Morden, all of which are situated off the main road.
